title: Remove entry point parameters from run

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

- Client: 1.29
- Tracking server: 1.29

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Ubuntu 22.04
- **Python version**: Python 3.9
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**: n/a

### Describe the problem

When running an MLproject entry point through the Python API
```python
params = {"bar1": "hello", "bar2": "world"}
mlflow.projects.run("./", entry_point='main', parameters=params, experiment_name="big_foo")
```
assuming that in `MLproject` one has defined an entry point `"main"` accepting parameters `bar1, bar2`, it seems that the parameters in `params` are logged as part of the run.

Is there any way to avoid that behaviour and/or delete these entries (seems forbidden as it triggers an exception in v1.29)?

Example of issue:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26378999/203929367-94124144-d6a1-4081-8699-916a609b5580.png)


### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

`MLproject` file
```
name: test_issue
entry_points:
  main:
    parameters:
      bar1: {type: string, default: "a"}
      bar2: {type: string, default: "b"}
    command: "python main.py --bar1 {bar1} --bar2 {bar2}"
```

Generic main: `main.py`
```python
import argparse
import mlflow


def main(bar1, bar2):
    print(f"Got {bar1} {bar2}")
    mlflow.log_metrics({"MyMetric": 0.0}, step=0)
    return True


if __name__ == "__main__":
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description="foo code"
    )

    parser.add_argument(
        "-b1",
        "--bar1",
        help="First parameter",
        default=None,
        required=True,
        type=str,
    )

    parser.add_argument(
        "-b2",
        "--bar2",
        help="Second parameter",
        default=None,
        required=True,
        type=str,
    )

    args = parser.parse_args()
    main(args.bar1, args.bar2)
```

Project runner script: `run.py`

```python
import mlflow
import datetime

def run():
    exp_name = "Default"
    run_name = "MyRun-" + datetime.datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d-%H%M%S")
    params = {'bar1': 'hello', 'bar2': 'world'}
    mlflow.run('./', entry_point='main', env_manager='local', experiment_name=exp_name, run_name=run_name,
               parameters=params)
    return


if __name__ == "__main__":
    run()
    exit(0)
```


### Stack trace

n/a

### Other info / logs

_No response_
